body.class: mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr mw-hide-empty-elt ns-0 ns-subject page-List_of_teams_and_cyclists_in_the_2018_Tour_de_France rootpage-List_of_teams_and_cyclists_in_the_2018_Tour_de_France skin-vector action-view

div.h1: List of teams and cyclists in the 2018 Tour de France

div.p: The following teams and cyclists will take part in the 2018 Tour de France:[1]

tr.td: Starting number worn by the rider during the Tour
Deficit to the winner of the general classification
Denotes riders born on or after 1 January 1993 eligible for the young rider classification
Denotes the winner of the general classification
Denotes the winner of the points classification

img.alt: White jersey with red polka dots jersey
img.title: Mountains classification

tr.td: Denotes the winner of the mountains classification
Denotes the winner of the young rider classification (eligibility indicated by )

img.alt: A white jersey with a yellow dossard
img.title: Team classification

tr.td: Denotes riders that represent the winner of the team classification

img.alt: A white jersey with a red dossard
img.title: Super-combativity award

tr.td: Denotes the winner of the super-combativity award
Denotes a rider who did not start a stage, followed by the stage before which he withdrew
Denotes a rider who did not finish a stage, followed by the stage in which he withdrew
Denotes a rider who was disqualified from the race, followed by the stage in which this occurred
Denotes a rider finished outside the time limit, followed by the stage in which they did so

td.i: Age correct as of Saturday 7 July 2018, the date on which the Tour began

a.title: 2018 Tour de France, Stage 1 to Stage 11
2018 Tour de France, Stage 1 to Stage 11
2018 Tour de France, Stage 1 to Stage 11
2018 Tour de France, Stage 1 to Stage 11

div.p: The 176 riders that are competing in the 2018 Tour de France originated from 30 different countries.
